en.purpose: To assess the Prague C and M classification for Barrett's Esophagus
en.use: This classification consists of two components, the C value, which measures the distance from the gastroesophageal junction to the highest location where metaplasia is present around the entire circumference of the esophagus, and the M value, which measures the distance from the gastroesophageal junction to the highest location of metaplasia.

Sharma P, Dent J, Armstrong D, Bergman JJ, Gossner L, Hoshihara Y, Jankowski JA, Junghard O, Lundell L, Tytgat GN, Vieth M. Epub 2006 Aug 16. PMID: 17101315.

Vahabzadeh B, Seetharam AB, Cook MB, Wani S, Rastogi A, Bansal A, Early DS, Sharma P. Validation of the Prague C & M criteria for the endoscopic grading of Barrett's esophagus by gastroenterology trainees: a multicenter study. Gastrointest Endosc. 2012 Feb;75(2):236-41. doi: 10.1016/j.gie.2011.09.017. PMID: 22248595; PMCID: PMC4547779.
other_details.en: Barrett’s esophagus is a premalignant condition for adenocarcinoma of the esophagus and gastroesophageal junction. This classification stratifies the severity of Barrett's esophagus based on endoscopic findings.
